member.name: IMFSampleGrabberSinkCallback2.OnProcessSampleEx
member.summary: Called when the sample-grabber sink receives a new media sample.
member.param: The major type GUID that specifies the format of the data. For a list of possible values, see Major Media Types.
Sample flags. The sample-grabber sink gets the value of this parameter by calling the method of the media sample.
The presentation time for this sample, in 100-nanosecond units. If the sample does not have a presentation time, the value of this parameter is _I64_MAX

param.name: llSampleDuration
param.para: The duration of the sample, in 100-nanosecond units.
If the sample does not have a duration, the value of this parameter is _I64_MAX.

member.param: A pointer to a buffer that contains the sample data.
The size, in bytes, of the pSampleBuffer buffer.
A pointer to the interface. Use this interface to get the attributes for this sample (if any). For a list of sample attributes, see Sample Attributes.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
